item.title: Report E-2023060222
item.description:
Report E-2023060222

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-19T09:09:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-30
  • City: GREENBRIER
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A plastic receptacle in a UN Rated cardboard box was punctured by a nail protruding from the pallet that the box was placed on. This box was under several others so the combined weight of the stacked boxes on top of the box with the material in question caused the nail to puncture both the outer and inner container resulting in a release.

item.title: Report E-2023060173
item.description:
Report E-2023060173

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-19T09:09:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-22
  • City: GREENBRIER
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: This drum was crushed due to a shift in the load. The root cause of this incident is improper load securement. When the load shifted it caused this drum to become crushed and the denting of the drum caused a breach in the side wall of the drum near the bottom allowing all of the contents of the drum to be released.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking paint at the unload side. Package was put in a hazardous bag and place in a red tote. The red tote was delivered to QA cage for further inspection. DescribePack: Paint can had quarter inch cracked at the bottom of the can causing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: When the package was found leaking paint, it was put in a hazardous bag and into a red tote.

item.title: Report E-2023060020
item.description:
Report E-2023060020

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-19T09:09:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-15
  • City: ANTIOCH
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 15, 2023, two (1) 1-gallon pails of UN3266 were damaged by a load shift and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted surfaces. HES personnel deployed granular absorbents and swept them in using hand tools. The crew containerized all waste in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023051213
item.description:
Report X-2023051213

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-19T09:09:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-22
  • City: KODAK
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found while helping load a driver's truck. Box was in a cart loaded by package handlers. Upon inspection of the box, it gave off an incredibly strong scent and was wet due to leaking. The hazmat was identified and was placed in a bag and put in a hazmat toat. Once it was contained, it was moved to the hazmat cage immediately to be worked. DescribePack: The bottles were leaking from the bottom, but no large or noticeable hole or puncture was found. Both bottles were wet at the bottom. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: it was put in a toat, and was moved back up to the upright position.

item.title: Report X-2023050834
item.description:
Report X-2023050834

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-19T09:09:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-15
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Ops admin discovered a wet fiberboard box on the HMPA staging pallet. Events prior are unclear. DescribePack: One of the four 1 gallon plastic jerricans of Nitrical Bone Decalcifier #1213-1 lost approximately 3 oz of fluid due to interior corrosion of the seal under the cap closure. The bottle was dented on the side closest the cap closure; within the package the dented side rested not against the sidewall of the package but against another bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a lined tote before being left by the HMPA. PPE was donned and ventilation was utilized.

item.title: Report X-2023050771
item.description:
Report X-2023050771

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-19T09:09:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-10
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE FELL OVER ON ITS SIDE WHILE ON PACKAGE VAN TO BE DELIVERED. DRIVER FOUND LEAKING OUT AND CALLED BUSINESS CONTACT TO COME RETRIEVE FROM HIM. BC BROUGHT BACK TO STATION AND GAVE TO QA AND PLACE IN SALVAGE DRUM. NUETRALIZER WAS USED TO CLEAN THE SPILL DescribePack: CAP FELL OFF DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN TOTE BY DRIVER. WHEN IT RETURNED TO THE STATION IT WAS IMMEDIATELY PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM. NEUTRALIZER WAS USED TO CLEAN SPILLAGE. MOST OF THE LIQUID POURED OUT IN THE SALVAGE DRUM DUE TO PACKAGE BEING LAID ON ITS SIDE.

  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was called to the the heavy weight build up area for a leaking package. The agent was given two steel drums that were damaged from being crushed by a dolly. One drum was a total loss and the other was leaking from the top and bottom chimes. They were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

  • City: MEMPHIS

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: on May 14th, a package was discovered at the Memphis Hub in a plastic back leaking. The package was marked UN1263 Paint Related Materials, 3, PGII. Inside was a 1 qt metal can that does not appear to have positive closure, allowing the lid to come lose and spill the contents. DG Admin advised them to place the package in a steel salvage drum and to contact the shipper for an amended shippers declaration in order to allow the shipment to continue.

item.description:
Report X-2023050631

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-19T09:09:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-11
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Ops admin discovered a wet fiberboard box containing a fully regulated hazmat on the HMPA staging pallet. Events prior to discovery unknown. DescribePack: The drum has a pinhole-sized puncture seated within a severe dent into which the handle of the drum comfortably sits. It is believed the exposed metal of the handle made impact with the side of the drum during transit, leading to a leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was found within a lined and lidded tote. PPE was donned and ventilation was used for investigation.

item.title: Report X-2023050604
item.description:
Report X-2023050604

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-19T09:09:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-11
  • City: KODAK
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-03
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During normal switching operation a train crew observed liquid running down the side of the car and originating from the area of the manway. The car was set out and the area was isolated. I response contractor was called to investigate and repair the leaking car. The contractor found the single bolt on the clincher style manway was less than tool tight. The manway was opened and the gasket was inspected but no defects were noted. The manway was resecured in a tool tight condition. The contractor also inspected the other fittings and no exceptions were found. The exterior of the car was neutralized and cleaned. No product reached the ground.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package brought back to station by driver after Walmart noticed the box after package was delivered and refused it. Outside of box was wet, mottled and seams are failing due to saturation. Package was removed and placed into Hazmat holding area for inspection. DescribePack: Upon inspection, all 4 jugs inside the box are also individually poly bagged with heat sealed seams. Two jugs show visible wetness inside their bags and caps feel loose, were allowed to be tightened. They are also soiled/stained. There is a small tear in the top of one bag which allowed product to escape into inner box and eat away at inner packaging. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat vented hood used to inspect damage, nitrile gloves worn at all times.

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-20
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: spilldevgrp@fedex.com
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Package was offered to the spill agent at our Charlotte, NC ramp location emitting a strong odor. Package was found during the offload of an aircraft during sort operations, and it appeared to be a fibreboard box containing UN 1112, Benzene. Initially there was no indication of leakage, however further inspection found inside the outer package there was a plastic moisture barrier. Inside this barrier were pigmats and smaller fiberboard box which did show signs of leaking. Box contained a bottle of Benzene which was reported the cap was loose and the contents inside were leaking. Both boxes were fully marked and labeled for DG travel although shipper's declaration did not list the shipment as an overpack. Although the contents did not breech the outer box it was seen the inner bottle was over 1/2 empty. shipment has been placed in a steel salvage drum and is being held pending FAA investigation.

The driver got out of the cab and noticed the dome had not been properly closed. The driver immediately realized there was a release of material and it was cleaned up by facility personnel.

  • Description: On April 13, 2023, three (3) 5-gallon pails of UN1263 were damaged in a load shift and released approximately five (5) gallons to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services LC who dispatched a crew from TPM to remediate the site. TPM personnel overpacked the three (3) damaged containers in one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport back to the terminal. The crew then utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to collect and containerize all UN1263 impacted material in one (1) separate 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023040974
item.description:
Report X-2023040974

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-19T09:09:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-12
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Operations admin were advised a fully regulated hazmat spill had occurred at the end of Hub Load Area 5, near V101 door. A work area manager was questioned about the color of the diamond label (red or black and white) to determine whether the spill consisted of a corrosive or flammable liquid and what initial PPE should be donned. Management did not know and neglected to call over the radio to determine this; WAM was advised to keep an eye on the colors of hazard diamond labels in the future as it may help to expedite admin-led spill response. After gathering spill response equipment (including 2020 ERG), three admin and one qa manager responded to spill cleanup; began blotting liquid with absorbent pads and neutralizing spill radius. DescribePack: One plastic 5 gallon pail/bucket was observed to be the source of spillage. The cap closure was not found and it is unclear whether the cap was initially loose or broke free from rough handling of Incompatible packages. V101 door typically houses trailers intended for loading of Incompatible packages. Of the 5 gallons, 4.9 gallons were released at the time of discovery. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: At the site, management advised package handlers to vacate the area temporarily. Corrosive PPE was donned, neutralizer and absorbent pads were gathered by admin. The pail/bucket was isolated in a lined open tote to negate any closed reaction or pressure build up. The UN number was identified and the 2020 ERG was consulted for UN1760 materials to review PPE required/fire/first aid measures. Admin started systemically blotting and absorbing fluid. Neutralizer was applied to the entire area and collected once reaction had subsided. Spillage and absorbent pads were collected and transferred to the HMPA. Once neutralization and absorption was complete, admin provided the SDS for Operations Safety personnel and the contracted custodian team with Section 4 highlighted, in case exposure symptoms were observed with any contracted vendor or employee.

item.title: Report X-2023040951
item.description:

  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NKX experienced a UN2922 Polycat 15 release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 5' x 3' area of the trailer floor due to a cracked tote. The product was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023040628
item.description:
Report X-2023040628

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-19T09:09:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-10
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Ops admin discovered a wet white plastic 5 gallon drum of PPC (Protective Products Corp) Crud Remover 03-640 on the HMPA staging pallet. The drum had a corrosive diamond label on the side (pre-printed as a part of the original manufacturer label) and an 889 barcode originating from 375 KODAK. DescribePack: The 5 gal drum was actively leaking upon discovery. A 2 inch gouge/crack to the underside of the drum was present and the drum had lost approximately 3.2 gallons at the time of reporting. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: PPE for handling Corrosives was donned; the SDS was consulted. The package was investigated under the ventilation hood and placed upside down in a salvage drum to stem the flow of product from the crack in the underside.

  • Description: A LOADER WAS LOADING A PACKAGE IN A TRAILER AND IT STARTED TO RIP. HE NOTICED THAT THE PACKAGE CONTAINED AMMO AND BROUGHT IT TO THE ATTENTION OF HIS SUPERVISOR, WHO HAD ME CALL HMMS. HMMS ESTABLISHED THAT THE AMMO WAS NOT DECLARED ON THE OUTER PACKAGING AND IS THEREFORE AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT. A SUPERVISOR TOOK DOCUMENTATION PHOTOS FOR ADG COMPLIANCE. ADDITIONAL PACKAGES: 1Z940X31A846854959 AND 1Z940X31A880189168.

  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: spilldevgrp@fedex.com
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Memphis Spill Office called in spills on two separate packages of the same shipment. The fiberboard outer packages did not show a UN Specification code but each contained 12 glass bottles of UN1203 Gasoline, 3, PGII, of which 5 bottles in total broke or had their lids come off. The bottles appeared to have been cushioned with packing peanuts and cardboard separators but no positive closure, or absorbent materials were in the outer package, leading Dg Admin to believe these were improperly packaged for transport.. The Shippers declaration of Dangerous goods also did not appear to be correct as the quantity listed is not consistent with the packages.

item.title: Report X-2023040564
item.description:
Report X-2023040564

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-18T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-29
  • City: HUMBOLDT
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023040564 SequenceEvent: Hazardous material not secured during transportation; the bucket ended up moving around because of this. Upon arrival at facility, the hazmat was removed from the vehicle and put into a hazmat spill bag and into a separate container. Gloves and towels were used to remove any excess paint. DescribePack: The lid received minor damage and only had a small leak. There were other small indentions to the side of the bucket. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Removing the hazmat from the van and into and into a hazmat spill pale to prevent further release. 2. X-2023040566 SequenceEvent: Driver did not have the hazmat secured during transit, thus causing the hazmat to fall over and move around. This caused enough damage to the bucket and paint spilled everywhere. Once the driver returned to the facility, it was immediately removed and put into a hazmat spill bag. DescribePack: Bucket received several indentations on the side and caused a small rupture where the handle on the side was. The hole was not very big but it was still enough for paint to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Putting the hazmat into a spill bag and into a separate container.

Package was discovered during normal sort operation and was seen a fibreboard box containing UN 3082 was wet and showed signs of leaking inside. Box contained an open head steel drum carrying 18 L of commodity of which it is estimated 10L were able to escape from the lid area. it was not reported how the lid was damaged and allowed for the spillage, Drum did have UN specifications, however they were partially washed away in the spill. item.description:
Report E-2023030721

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-18T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-24
  • City: KINGSPORT
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 3/24/23 at 12:47 personnel in the CSXT Kingsport Yard discovered UTLX205397, a loaded tank car of acetone leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and Advansix were notified CHEMTREC Report #2023-03-24-00167. Marion Environmental Inc, a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the liquid valve leaking from the flange fitting plate connection, all four nuts were loose. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper Charline Talfinger, Advansix_maintenance@railtrac.com, 281.362.6721. Contractor personnel tightened all four flange connection nuts and the leak stopped and Marion Environmental hand excavated the impacted rock ballast below the car and wiped the car down. The leak was secured and the car released for transport. This incident did require a special switching move.

However, upon inspection, it was seen package package had staining indicating there was a spill inside. Package was a fibreboard box and contained glass 12 bottles each able to contain 1 L of product. There were pig mats used to cushion the walls of the box, but otherwise no dunnage was used nor a moisture barrier. Bottles inside the package had broken and allowed for the contents to spill. Package was placed in a steel salvage drum and shipper was contacted for disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023030954
item.description:
Report X-2023030954

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-18T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-08
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Ops admin discovered a plastic Coleman cooler (100 Quart capacity) sealed with fortified strapping tape and a "Request for Analysis/Chain of Custody Form" from the shipper Manufacturing Sciences Corporation taped to the top. No barcode was found. In an attempt to find the barcode or shipping manifest, the cooler was opened and diagnostic samples of human urine were discovered within. The shipper provided the barcode when called and it was noted that the barcode was a FedEx Ground label not FedEx Express. The shipper noted that shipments of diagnostic samples had continued unabated through the FedEx Ground network since 2011. DescribePack: Upon opening the outer container, admin noted a noticeable smell. No visible spillage was observed. Despite the presence of two seals on the bottles within plastic zipped bags and the occasional presence of minimally wet absorbent pads, it was noted that the shipper did not follow the FedEx Express guidelines for preparing clinical samples for shipment. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE was donned and surrounding dock doors remained open for ventilation. Upon identification of a potential biohazard, the cooler was immediately removed from operations and secured within the HMPA.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Ops admin discovered a torn, wet fiberboard overpack box in a tote on the HMPA staging pallet. Sequence of events prior to this is unclear, beyond initial discovery of the damage on the unload dock and subsequent transport to HMPA. DescribePack: The package contains two 5L plastic jerricans of Medivators Rapicide PA Part A (fully regulated) and two 5L plastic jerricans of Part B (not regulated). Part A had tightly secured blue vented caps and lost approximately 0.1L due to the package laying on its side for an undetermined length of time. Part B lost 2 tbsps of material due to loose unvented caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a bag-lined, lidded tote upon initial discovery. PPE was donned before investigation and cleanup took place.

Further investigation indicated the box contained four bottles of UN1210, printing ink, 3, II, which the inner contents leaked out from the top of one of the bottles. Following the spill cleanup the involved package was placed inside a salvage drum and held pending further disposition.

item.title: Report E-2023020214
item.description:
Report E-2023020214

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-18T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-02
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 2, 2023, at 2130 ET, XPO Logistics Terminal NMP experienced a UN2922 "DIALD 50" release from a 55-gallon poly drum. The release impacted the trailer floor and asphalt lot below due to a forklift puncture. At 2218 ET, XPO notified ERTS of the release. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and containment. On February 2, 2023, at 0054 ET, contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 40-gallons of product released to the trailer floor in an 8' x 20' area and a 50' x 6' area of the concrete lot below the trailer due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The area was neutralized with sodium bicarb solution until pH strips read as 7. All impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were collected and containerized into (11) 55-gallon poly drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023010183
item.description:
Report E-2023010183

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-18T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-05
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 5th, 2023, at 0326 personnel in the CSXT Radnor Yard discovered GATX216232, a residue tank car of hydrochloric acid leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and Jones Hamilton, Nashville Fire and EMS, TEMA, and NRC were notified CHEMTREC Report #2023-01-05-00033. Ryan Godsey CSXT hazardous materials manager, and Marion Environmental Inc., a CSX response contractor was dispatched to the scene and found an active vapor release coming from the fittings plate and tank car connection. 20 of 20 fittings plate bolts were found to be less than tool tight. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper Sam Perras, 419-666-9838, sperras@jones-hamilton.com. Contractor personnel secured the 20 fittings plate bolts and decontaminated the car. The leak was secured, and the car is currently being held at the terminal until the tank car is properly cleaned & purged, and the fittings plate bolts are properly torqued to manufacturers spec. This incident did not require a special switching move. One CSX employee did have EMS evaluate him and he did go to the hospital. After being evaluated at the hospital he was discharged with no facility administrated medications.

item.title: Report X-2023010849
item.description:
Report X-2023010849

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-18T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-17
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE HAZMAT WAS BROUGHT OVER TO THE DESIGNATED TRUCK TO BE LOADED ONTO THE ROUTE FROM THE TRAILER BY A PACKAGE HANDLER WHO IS ASSIGNED TO RUN NON-CONVEYABLES TO THE CORRECT AREAS OF THE BUILDING BY HAND. THE PACKAGE HANDLER LOADING THE TRUCK ON THE VAN LINE NOTICED A SMALL BLEACHED LOOKING SPOT LOCATED AT THE BOTTOM OF THE FIBERBOARD BOX AND DID NOT CONTINUE LOADING IT. QA WAS NOTIFIED IMMEDIATELY AND HAZMAT WAS BROUGHT OVER TO THE APPROPRIATE PROCESSING AREA. THERE WAS NO SPILLAGE IN VAN, ON TUGGER TRAIN OR IN THE TRAILER. THE LEAK DID NOT REACH THE POINT OF SPILLING OUTSIDE OF THE BOX. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE ITSELF WAS NOT AT FAULT. THERE IS NO VISIBLE DAMAGE TO THE OUTER PACKAGING. INSIDE OF THE PACKAGE THERE WERE 4 1-GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES OF CORROSIVE CONTAINED IN PLASTIC BAGS. THE CAPS WERE TAPED. THE EXTRA SPACE WAS FILLED WITH HAZMATPAC ABSORBENT VERMICULITE THAT ABSORBED MAJORITY OF THE SPILLED LIQUID. UPON INSPECTION OF THE PLASTIC 1-GAL BOTTLES, THE CAPS WERE ALL IN TACT. 1 OF THE 4 BOTTLES HAD LESS LIQUID AND CORROSIVE INSIDE OF THE PLASTIC BAG. THE CAP TO THIS BOTTLE WAS SECURE. IT SEEMS LIKE THERE IS A SMALL CRACK IN THE LINING OF THE PLASTIC BOTTLE THAT IS NOT EASILY VISIBLE. IT APPEARS THAT MAYBE FROM THE TEMPERATURE CHANGE AFTER BEING IN TRANSIT FROM CALIFORNIA TO TENNESSEE, THE WEATHER CHANGED SIGNIFICANTLY AND POSSIBLY IMPACTED THE STRUCTURE OF THE PLASTIC GALLONS THROUGH HEAT EXPANSION AND WEATHER VARIATION. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE ASBORBENT VERMICULITE INSIDE OF THE FIBERBOARD BOX CONTAINED THE RELEASE OF THE SPILL IMMEDIATELY.

item.title: Report E-2023010377
item.description:
Report E-2023010377

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-18T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-13
  • City: CHATTANOOGA
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MC Tank Transport, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 13, 2023, ERTS was contacted by MC Tank Transport personnel in Chattanooga, Tennessee requesting facilitation of the cleanup of a release of a Sodium Bisulfite solution (Bisulfites, aqueous solution, n.o.s., UN2693, 8, III) from (1) 5,000-gallon tanker. ERTS then dispatched contractors to manage all onsite cleanup activities. Following contractor arrival and assessment of the involved cargo, it was determined that approximately 20 gallons of sodium bisulfite solution was released to a 2 by 2 area of gravel beneath the tanker. The release was reportedly due to a leak from the CTMV sleeve. Contractors cleaned up the release using absorbents, hand tools and the proper PPE. The spent absorbents and all other waste generated were containerized in (3) 55-gallon plastic drums. The waste drums were then transported offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023010568
item.description:
Report E-2023010568

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-18T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-30
  • City: DANDRIDGE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 30, 2022 at 0430 ET, an XPO Logistics terminal NTR tractor trailer was traveling down I-40 when the unit was involved in a roll over accident occurring at mile marker 418 eastbound. As a result, the unit experienced an over the road cargo release from multiple 5-gallon and 1-gallon containers of non-regulated On an' On, non-regulated Tribase, non-regulated Xcelente, non-regulated Clean by 4D, UN1903 Sani-T Plus, & UN1750 RJ8 Tile & Grout Rejuvenator. Additional products Honda Dual Pump Fluid II & Glass Cleaner Non-Ammoniated Formula were damaged but not releasing. ERTS dispatched contractors to the scene to help conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons in total of the above products released to the asphalt lot in a 15' x 5' area and the soil shoulder in a 2' x 2' area due to an over the road roll over accident. Contractors advised the majority of the release was from four damaged 5-gallon containers of non-regulated On an' On which were completely empty of all contents. Crew completed a soil scrape to collect all impacted soil. Absorbents were worked into the impacted trailer floor and asphalt roadway and collected along with the soil into a 55-gallon metal drum. All damaged and impacted product were collected and containerized by product into 13 waste drums. The waste was transported to XPO's terminal located in Blountville, TN for personnel to manage. Sample analysis is currently pending for the soil scrape completed and once received, the incident will be closed.

  • Description: On December 07, 2022, ERTS received a request to dispatch a remediation contractor to address a reported 10-gallon release of UN3265 Busan 94 that was by impact damage from a load shift during transit on trailer 754076. Upon contractor arrival, the only cargo on the involved trailer was the damaged drum of concern. Accordingly, this drum was overpacked and then affected trailer flooring components were properly addressed. Affected absorbents and debris were subsequently containerized into a total of two (2) 55-gallon drums pending proper disposal. All requested services were completed successfully, without incident.

  • Description: Packages were called in to the spill office at the Memphis Hub location and reported to DG Admin on 24 Dec 2022. 2 boxes (Master TRK# 611283429359) were leaking, and all contents were placed in steel salvage packages. Each box contained 1 smaller box and 1 sheet of bubble wrap for dunnage. Each smaller box contained 12 plastic spray bottles and fiberboard dividers. For TRK# 611283429359, 4 of the 12 bottles lost their contents via loosened screw tops. For TRK# 611283429360, 3 of the 12 bottles lost their contents via loosened screw tops. Shipper contacted for disposition and an amended Shipper's Declaration for continued movement.

  • Description: On December 22, 2022, one (1) 55-gallon drum containing UN1505 was involved in a forklift accident and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement underneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to assess and remediate the site. HES personnel secured the released product in a separate bag and resecured the valve.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 21, 2022, one (1) 55-gallon drum of xylenes solution (UN1307) was damaged due to a load shift and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer interior and concrete underneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from TPM Group (TPM) to assess and remediate the site as necessary. TPM personnel overpacked the damaged 55-gallon drum in one (1) 95-gallon overpack, then deployed granular absorbents to the impacted surfaces. The crew then collected all xylene solution-impacted material in two (2) 55-gallon drums for future transport and disposal.

While investigating the package the agent observed that the single paint can inside was dented on the lid. This dent broke the seal causing a release inside of the fiberboard box. The can had a positive closure ring. It was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained before movement.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-18T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-19
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0850 AM ET, XPO Terminal NNA reported a spill that occurred inside of a trailer and on the dock in Nashville, TN. The spill consisted of (1) 55 gallon poly drum of Prep Pre-Soak, which was punctured by a loose nail on the pallet it was loaded onto, and the nail caused a puncture at the bottom of the drum which caused a spill of approximately 1 gallon. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 6' x 2' area of the trailer floor, 2' x 2' area of the dock and 4' x 3' area of the lot due to puncture by a pallet nail. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly drum to be shipped on. Impacted absorbents and cleanup debris was containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: The east exception slide called the spill office at our Memphis Hub location regarding a baggage cart in their area. The cart contained a wet Class 3 box. The cart contained multiple dangerous goods pieces but only one was leaking. The box had noticeable wet spots on the outer package. No other packages got leaked on. There were 4 plastic bottles within a fibreboard box. There was a center divide in the box but no dunnage. 2 of teh plastic bottles had loose caps that allowed a small amount to leak out. The caps were tightened and all the contents were contained into a Steel Salvage Package. Shipment is domestic and the shipper has been contacted. Shipper will provide an amended shipper's declaration so that the shipment may continue transit.

  • Description: Package was offered to the spill office at our Memphis Hub facility. Package was found during normal sort operations in a baggage cart with leakage coming from the bottom of the box. Inspection found the fibreboard box contained 2 metal drums each containing 5L of UN 1866. As the package was Limited Quantity, the box was not UN spec. It was reported brown packing paper was used for dunnage, however, there was not a moisture barrier used. Positive closure was not confirmed. Leakage was seen to be coming from the lid of one drum and allowed for an estimated 500ML to escape. it is not known the cause of the leakage. Package was placed in a steel salvage drum and shipper was contacted for an amended shippers declaration for continued travel.

  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: NMP called in to report a 5-gallon spill of UN1760 Winkote 3390SW from a 55-gallon plastic drum caused by improper loading and impacting their trailer floor. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 3' x 12' area of the trailer floor due to a loose bung cap. Soda ash was utilized to neutralize the impacted area. The damaged bung was replaced with a new vented bung cap. The impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: Driver was in transit with a van load of waste sulfuric acid in fiber drums and plastic totes. Driver was performing an enroute safety check and noticed a drip coming from the trailer. Upon investigation it was determined that one of the totes was leaking. Pads were placed under the trailer to absorb the drip/ spill until emergency response crew arrived. Emergency response crew repaired container, cleaned and decontaminated the trailer and cleaned up the small quantity of liquid that reached the ground. Load continued on to destination.

  • Description: Package was called into the spill office at our Memphis hub location. A blue plastic jerrican on the bottom noncon belt was wet due to a small amount of leakage (0.1 L). A portion of the jerrican was dented at the top which apparently caused some of the contents to leak out the cap. The cause of the dent is unknown. There was no wet spots on the belt but the area was cleaned with soap and water for good measure. Shipment was bagged and brought back to the DG office and subsequently contained into a Steel Salvage Package. Shipper will be contacted regarding an amended Declaration and RTS to their US address as it's an international shipment (Spain).

The shipment was ruled a total loss and will be disposed of at hazardous waste. Cylinder stamped with markings DOT-3AA1800A 6994785Y ANSUL

  • Description: Part of a 11 piece shipment, this package was called into the spill office at our Memphis hub location when it was seen the package was leaking. Package was found during normal sort operations and is the second package of this shipment to be found leaking. Package consisted of a fibreboard box with 5 gallon plastic bucket inside. There was no moisture barrier nor dunnage reported. It was seen the lid of the bucket was loose from the bucket and allowed for an estimated 6L of UN 3982 to leak out of the package. Package was placed in a steel salvage drum and shipper was contacted for disposition.

  • Description: Package was called into the spill office at our Memphis hub location when it was seen during night time sort operations a package presented with a wet corner indicating the possibility of a leak inside. Package was a fibreboard box marked as containing UN 1263. Further inspection found the package contained 2 metal cans each filled 3.78L of UN 1263. each can was individually wrapped in a moisture barrier. Bubble wrap was used for dunnage, and it was not reported if the metal cans had positive closure. It was reported one of the can opened during travel and allowed for inner commodity to leak out. Package was placed in a steel salvage drum and shipper was contacted for an amended shipper's declaration for continued travel.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Ops admin found leaking class 3 hazmat on loadside. RTS label from 358 HUNT & OP-908 Shipper error notification found on package, alluding to package label suggesting UN1120 Butanols are inside whereas OP-900 and hazmat paperwork signify that it should be UN1090 Acetone. Package taken to hmpa for investigation. DescribePack: Absolutely no acetone present within package. Contents: Letco Medical Butyl Alcohol (n-Butanol NF) within 1 undamaged (4LT) plastic bottle and 6 (500ml) glass bottles, 2 of which have shattered cap closures. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Upon discovery, package placed within a bag-lined, lidded tote for immediate transfer to HMPA.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was placed onto the IC belt. At the destination of the package within the building the package had fallen off of the IC belt onto the floor. Upon impact the two 2.5 Gallon containers inside the package had cracked and the liquid contents within the containers had started to leak out, soaked one side of the shipping container, and leaked onto the floor. DescribePack: A small crack is near the seam of the container under the handle. This small crack is almost in the exact same spot on both 2.5 Gallon containers within the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA was notified immediately of the incident. The package was placed into a black tote and placed upon the desk in the Hazmat cage.

  • Description: Package was called into the spill office at our Memphis Hub location. When the clean up specialist arrived they were shown a package which was wet on the bottom and side of the box indicating a leak on within. Package was a fibreboard box which contained 2 bottles of UN2672. Each bottle contained 2.5L and was wrapped in a plastic bag as a moisture barrier. it was not reported if there was dunnage in the box. During the course of sort operation, one of the bottles broke inside of the box allowing for the total content of the bottle to spill. Package was placed in a steel salvage drum after clean up and Shipper was contacted for an amended Shipper's Declaration for continued travel.

  • Description: Part of a multi piece shipment 2 pieces were offered to a clean up specialists at our Memphis Hub location. It was reported both pieces were steel drums which had 2 push nozzles for release on top of drum. Each nozzle was covered with a small plastic cap, which in turn was covered by a metal covering and the units themselves were placed in an overpack. The metal coverings and plastic caps had come off the nozzles allowing for The commodity UN 2920 to leak out. Packages were placed in steel salvage packages and shipper was contacted for an amended shipper's declaration for continued travel.

item.title: Report X-2022110179
item.description:
Report X-2022110179

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-18T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-18
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: spilldevgrp@fedex.com
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: **No accurate classifcation could be obtained due to the fire incident and the charred state of the package. The 4.1 classification was used as a place holder tp ensure 5800 submission** On 10/18/2022, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from DG Spill Office, reporting a package fire in the Secondary in International sort area. At approximately 0958, the package appeared to have ignited, resulting in a fire and causing damage to several other packages. The Hub Fire Department was called to the scene to extinguish the flame and neutralize the package. Per Captain Easton, the initial shipment appeared to have been tendered via US Postal Service and emitted an odor similar to paint thinner. Postal Transportation has taken possession of the initial package and the additional damaged packages. The National Response Center has been notified and a report has been filed under Report # 1350266 by Mr. Threatt. The Federal Aviation Administration has also been made aware of the incident.

item.description:
Report E-2022110071

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-18T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-05
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO terminal NMP reports a release of 55 gallons of "Araldite GY 281" (UN3082) after a 55-gallon metal drum was punctured by a forklift inside of the trailer. ERTS dispatched E3 to conduct cleanup. At 0102 ET, E3 personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 100-gallons of product released from 2 drums due to forklift punctures. The release impacted a 22' x 10' area of the trailer floor and a 35' x 10' area of the asphalt lot below the trailer. Absorbents were worked into the impacted areas and then collected into (3) 55-gallon metal drums. The two damaged drums were each placed into an 85 gallon poly overpack. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: XPO Terminal NKX called to report a hazardous cargo release. It was reported a 330 gallon poly tote containing UN 3265 "REA TIN OR RT 932" was discovered cracked and releasing approximately 10 gallons to the trailer floor. ERTS dispatched Hepaco to conduct cleanup. At 1854 ET, contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to a 4 x 4' area of the trailer floor from a 330-gallon poly tote. Absorbents were worked into the impacted area and collected. The product was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The old tote was the cut up. All waste was containerized into three 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On Oct 25th at approximately 1115 nine vape pens were lying in the drive lane on the ramp and one was run over causing the lithium battery to explode. Local management extinguished the fire and EMS was not called. The vape pens were in retail packaging however there was no outer packaging. No shipper information or tracking number is available. The Memphis spill office took control of the remaining vape pens and the damaged one and they are being held pending further disposition. The vape pens also contain nicotine, I am unable to determine if this was classified as DG or not. Exact quantity of the release is unknown.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to perform the necessary corrective actions. FCE personnel utilized hand tools to collect the released product, then containerized the damaged bag and all sodium hydroxide-impacted material into one (1) 55-gallon drum for future disposal by RLC.

item.title: Report E-2022100594
item.description:
Report E-2022100594

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-18T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-14
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0919 ET, XPO terminal NMP contacted ERTS to report a spill that occurred inside a trailer at 0900 ET in Memphis, TN. The spill consisted of a 55 gallon poly drum containingUN1760 "WinKlean 4500", which arrived at the terminal in a damaged condition, likely due to it falling off of the pallet during transit, causing a small pin-sized hole which released approximately 2 cups onto the floor of the trailer and on the pallet. ERTS dispatched E3 to conduct cleanup operations. At 1325 ET, E3 personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 25 gallons of product released to a 15' x 3" area of the trailer and a 10' x 20' area of the concrete lot below the trailer. The damaged drum was containerized into an 85 gallon metal drum. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted areas and collected into (2) 55 gallon poly drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: Memphis spill agent was called for a leaking package to the dangerous goods building. They were given a fiberboard box in a plastic bag that was covered in what appeared to be white paint and told that the package had been dropped during sort operations. While investigating the contents of the fiberboard box they discovered that the lid on one of the four cans inside had come off releasing its contents. The cans were packaged with fiberboard divider. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended shipper's declaration.

It was reported to them that during travel from one site to another the drum fell and became damaged. Shipper was contacted and requested disposal of drum

Inspection of the package found 2, 5L metal cans containing UN1263. There was no positive closure on the cans, no moisture barriers used, and no dunnage reported. It was found one of the cans was leaking and allowed for an estimated .25L to escape. Package was placed in a steel salvage drum and shipper was contacted for an amended shipper's declaration for continued travel.

  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was called to the dangerous goods building for a leaking package. The agent was given a fiberboard box containing a class 8 that had signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained two plastic bottles wrapped in plastic with brown paper for dunnage. The cap was loose on one of the plastic bottles causing a release inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended shipper's declaration.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Package was discovered during the PM sort at our Memphis Hub location. Part of a 4-piece multipiece shipment, package was offered to the spill office when the box presented with odor and staining indicating a spill inside. Inspection of the package found 1 metal can marked Flammable UN1133. There was no positive closure on the can and it is reported loose pieces of Styrofoam were used as dunnage. This package was not offered as dangerous goods nor did it have marks or labels on the box indicating dangerous goods were being shipped. Package was placed in a steel salvage package and held for FAA investigation

  • Description: Spill clean-up employee was called to a spill in the heavy weight section of our Memphis hub. When they arrived, they found a steel drum containing UN 3082 as part of an overpack with 3 drums. It appeared the drum had come in contact with a forklift during the sort operation. This contact caused a puncture which allowed for entire contents to spill out of drum. Spill was cleaned and placed in a steel salvage drum and Shipper was called for disposition.

  • Description: 1 of 3 boxes (Master TRK# 777924391336) was wet and all contents were lost. The box contained 1 bottle and newspaper strips for dunnage. The bottle was wrapped in a bubble wrap sheet and enclosed in a single clear plastic bag. The bottom half of the bottle was shattered allowing the loss of all contents. It is not reported how bottle came to shatter. Per DG Admin, M. Drayden, packaging remnants are to be discarded/disposed.

  • Description: The spill office at our Memphis Hub location was called to a spill involving a spill of UN1798. Visual inspection of the package found a fibreboard box containing 3 glass bottles each holding 1.4L of commodity. It was reported 2 of the bottles were still in the box when the spill clean up agent was called, however one of the bottles had fallen from the bottom of the package and shattered. The fibreboard box was wet on the bottom and each bottle was wrapped in a pink pig mat. Package was contained an a steel salvage package and shipper was contacted for an amended shippers declaration for continued travel.

  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1707 EST, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at the terminal. It was reported that approximately 30 gallons of UN2428 Drexel Defol 5 Defoliant/Desiccant with Fire Retardant released in Trailer #313-2894 from a 275 gallon poly tote due to improper loading. ERTS dispatched E3 Environmental to conduct cleanup. At 2215 ET, E3 personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 125 gallons of product released to a 60' x 20' area of the asphalt lot and trailer floor. Oil dri was deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The remaining product in the damaged tote was transferred out into (3) 55 gallon poly drums. All spent absorbents were then collected and containerized into a 55 gallon poly drum. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized into 2 additional 55 gallon drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: Driver was using what we refer to as the intermodal fitting on the connection of our hose to the customer fill line. This fitting has a bleeder valve on it where you can safely depressurize charged lines. He had the ball valve for it closed but he forgot to put the cap on it. The valve itself was faulty. 1/2 gallon spilled in his catch bucket and on the ground. They wiped it up with spill pads and the rest evaporated.

item.title: Report X-2022090266
item.description:
Report X-2022090266

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-18T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-08
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: spilldevgrp@fedex.com
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was called to an input non con area for a leaking package. The agent was given a steel drum that was leaking from the lid. They discovered that the product label on the drum stated that the contents were classified as UN3082 and the the drum itself had a un specification marking. However the package had no hazardous labels or a shippers declaration. It was placed into a steel salvage package and being held for the FAA.

It was placed into steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended shippers declaration.

While investigating the package it was discovered that the contents did release. The fiberboard box contained sheets of bubble wrap for dunnage and a plastic bag sealed with a bag tie. The plastic bag contained three metal cans of paint and all three were leaking from their lids, None of the cans had positive closure on the lids. All the contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended shippers declaration.

item.title: Report I-2022110077
item.description:
Report I-2022110077

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-18T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-05
  • City: Memphis
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A MEMPHIS SPILL AGENT WAS CALLED TO THE DANGEROUS GOODS BUILDING FOR A LEAKING SHIPMENT. THE AGENT RECEIVED A FIBERBOARD BOX CONTAINING A UN1263 THAT HAD A BLACK LIQUID COMING FROM THE BOTTOM CORNER OF THE FIBERBOARD BOX. EMPLOYEE IN THE DANGEROUS GOODS BUILDING TOLD THE AGENT THAT THE SHIPMENT HAD BEEN DROPPED DURING THE LOADING PROCESS. WHILE INVESTIGATING THE SHIPMENT THE AGENT FOUND THAT THE METAL JERRYCAN INSIDE HAD A DAMAGED BOTTOM CORNER. THIS CAUSED THE SEAM TO OPEN AND RELEASE ITS CONTENTS INSIDE OF THE FIBERBOARD BOX. THE SHIPMENT WAS PLACED INTO A STEEL SALVAGE PACKAGE AND THE SHIPPER WAS CONTACTED FOR AN AMENDED SHIPPERS DECLARATION.

The agent was given a fiberboard box containing a class 3 which had what appeared to be white paint leaking from the corner and bottom seam. The cans had fiberboard dividers and positive closure rings. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended shippers declaration.

  • Description: Package was offered to the spill office at our Memphis Hub location when it was discovered at the end of one of the slides leaking. Inspection of the package found 4 glass bottles filled with UN 1760 inside of a fibeboard box. Each bottle was placed in a plastic moisture barrier and and at least one pressed paper pulp was found for the placement of the bottles. It was not reported if there was other dunnage in the package. during sort operations one of the glass bottles shattered and allowed for the entire contents ( 2.5L) to leak out of the package. Spill was cleaned an contents placed in a steel salvage container. Shipper had been contacted for disposition and amended shipper's declaration for continued travel We do not have shipper information. Values added to report to allow Hazmatics to accept report

The package was placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended shippers declaration.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found on unload side door 116 at 5pm Central. The trailer was 831448. The package was loaded on its side, The cap on one was loose. This caused the liquid inside of the container to leak. The box should have been loaded upright instead of on its side. DescribePack: The package was loaded on its side when it should have been kept upright. While loaded on its side, a small portion of the liquid spilled out from the side of the cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Gloves were used to place package in a tote and placed upright.

  • Description: ON 07/02/2022 AT APPROXIMATELY 0330, DANGEROUS GOODS ADMINSTRATION RECEIVED A CALL FROM EMPLOYEE 958599 AT THE HUB FACILITY IN MEMPHIS, REPORTING A PAINT SPILL. THE SHIPMENT CONSISTED OF I-20 L PAINT CAN INSIDE OF A FIBERBOARD BOX. THE CAN APPEARD TO LEAK FROM THE BODY. THE CAUSE OF THE SPILL IS UNKNOWN. THE ENTIRE SHIPMENT WAS PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM AND IS BEING HELD, AWAITING AN AMENDED DECLARATION FOR FURTHER DISPOSITION.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Package was brought to the attention of the dangerous goods specialist when it was seen package had a wet bottom indicating a leak. The fiberboard box containing 4 plastic jugs each containing 5L if UN 1824. The jugs were then placed in a plastic moisture barrier. There was liquid puddling at the bottom of the moisture barrier. It is reported caps were not tightened correctly , allowing product to leak out. Package was placed in a steel salvage drum and consignee contacted who requested shipment be destroyed.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The spill office located at our hub facility in Memphis TN was offered a package which was thought to be emitting a strong odor. When the package was opened for further inspection, it was found the package contained 2 plastic cans with metal tops containing UN1866. There was not positive closure reported on the cans, nor was dunnage reported in the package. It was seen tha tthe lids of two of the packages had opened from the can and allowed for product to leak out. Package was placed in a steel salvage container and shipper was contacted for amended shippers declaration for continued use.

The agent was presented an overpack shipment that appeared wet on the bottom of the fiberboard box. The package was placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper contacted for an amended shippers declaration.

  • Description: SPILL AGENT WAS CALLED TO THE DANGEROUS GOODS BUILDING FOR A LEAKING CLASS 8 SHIPMENT. THE AGENT NOTICED THAT THE BOTTOM OF THE FIBERBOARD BOX WAS WET AND OPENING UP. WHILE INVESTIGATING THE SHIPMENT THEY DISCOVERED THAT THE CAP ON ONE OF THE FOUR PLASTIC BOTTLES INSIDE WAS LOOSE. CAUSING IT TO SPILL ITS CONTENTS INTO THE FIBERBOARD BOX. THE SHIPMENT WAS PLACED INTO A STEEL SALVAGE PACKAGE AND THE SHIPPER WAS CONTACTED FOR AN AMENDED SHIPPERS DECLARATION.

FURTHER INVESTIGATION INDICATED THE BOX CONTAINED A BOTTLE OF UN2055 STYRENE MONOMER, STABILIZED PGIII, WHICH LEAKED FROM BEING DAMAGED DURING PACKAGE HANDLING AT THE HUB. item.title: Report I-2022110185
item.description:
Report I-2022110185

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-18T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-08
  • City: Memphis
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS OFFERED TO THE SPILL OFFICE AT OUR MEMPHIS HUB LOCATION SHOWING MOISTURE ON THE CORNER OF THE PACKAGE INDICATING THE MAY HAVE BEEN A SPILL WITHIN. INSPECTION OF THE PACKAGE FOUND A FIBERBOARD BOX WHICH CONTAINED 13 CANS OF UN 1263. EACH CAN CONTAINED 1 LITER OF PRODUCT. EACH CAN WAS SLIPPED INTO A BUBBLE WRAP POUCH. THE BOTTOM OF THE CANS WERE NOT WRAPPED AND LEFT EXPOSED. THERE WAS A LAYER OF BUBBLE WRAP ON THE BOTTOM OF THE BOX AND PACKING PEANUTS USED FOR DUNNAGE IN BETWEEN THE CANS. ONE OF THE CANS IN THE CORNER APPEARD TO BE LEAKING FROM THE SEAM AT THE BOTTOM OF THE CAN ALLOWING FOR THE DISCOLORATION. IT IS NOT KNOWN HOW THE DAMAGE OCCURRED TO THE BOTTOM OF THE METAL CAN. PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A STEEL SALVAGE DRUM AND SHIPPER WAS CONTACTED FOR AN AMENDED SHIPPERS DECLARATION FOR CONTINUED TRAVEL.

item.title: Report I-2022110183
item.description:
Report I-2022110183

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-18T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-08
  • City: Memphis
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1 OF 2 BOXES (MASTER TRK# 546460891649) WAS OFFERED TO THE MEMPHIS HUB SPILL OFFICE LEAKING AND ALL CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A STEEL SALVAGE PACKAGE. THE BOX CONTAINED 2 BOTTLES AND FIBERBOARD DIVIDERS FOR BLOCKING AND BRACING CONTENTS. EACH BOTTLE WAS INDIVIDUALLY WRAPPED IN YELLOW HAZMAT PADS, ENCLOSED IN A SINGLE CLEAR PLASTIC BAG SEALED VIA BAG TIE, AND SHRINK WRAPPED. THE SCREW CAPS FOR EACH BOTTLE DID NOT FIT PROPERLY AND WERE SEALED/ATTACHED VIA SOFT WAX (?). 1 OF THE 2 BOTTLES LEAKED ITS CONTENTS VIA ITS LOOSENED SCREW CAP. SHIPPER CONTACTED FOR AN AMENDED SHIPPERS DECLARATION FOR CONTINUED TRAVEL.

item.title: Report I-2022110055
item.description:
Report I-2022110055

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-18T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-19
  • City: Memphis
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ON JULY 19 AT 1429 THE MEMPHIS SPILL OFFICE CALLED STATING THAT THEY HAD THREE PACKAGE WITH A DRY ICE LABEL ON THEM, HOWEVER THE LABEL WAS NOT PROPERLY FILLED OUT. AFTER REVIEWING THAT THE SHIPPER WAS RED BEARD GUNWORKS, THEY OPENED ONE OF THE PACKAGES TO CONFIRM IF THERE WAS DRY ICE OR ANY GEL PACKS AND DISCOVERED THAT IT WAS FILLED WITH 5.56MM AMMUNITION. THE SPECIALIST CONTACTED DG ADMIN WHO INSTRUCTED THEM TO OPEN THE OTHER 2 PACKAGES, AND THEY FOUND THAT ALL THREE PACKAGES CONTAINED THE SAME AMMUNITION. DG ADMIN INSTRUCTED THE SPILL OFFICE TO HOLD THE PACKAGES UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE.

  • Description: ON 07/22/2022 AT APPROXIMATELY 2100, DANGEROUS GOODS ADMINISTRATION RECEIVED A CALL FROM EMPLOYEE 281407 AT THE HUB FACILITY IN MEMPHIS, REPORTING A PAINT SPILL. THE SHIPMENT CONSISTED OF 4 1-LITER CAN OF PAINT INSIDE OF A FIBERBOARD BOX. THE SHIPMENT APPEARS TO SUSTAIN DAMAGE DUE TO MISHANDLING, CAUSING ONE OF THE CANS TO BE CRUSHED, RESULTING IN LEAKAGE. THE DAMAGED CONTAINER WAS PLACE IN A DRUM AND SET FOR DISPOSAL AND THE REMAINING CANS WITH PLACED IN SEPARATE SALVAGE DRUM AND AWAITS AN AMENDED DECLARATION FOR FURTHER TRANSPORT.

item.title: Report I-2022110054
item.description:
Report I-2022110054

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-18T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-06
  • City: Memphis
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS OFFERED TO THE SPILL OFFICE AT OUR MEMPHIS HUB FACILITY. IT WAS REPORTED PACKAGE FELL TO GROUND AND AFTER LANDING IT WAS SEEN BOTTOM WAS WET INDICATING A SPILL WITHIN. INSPECTION OF PACKAGE FOUND THAT IT WAS PACKED IN A FIBERBOARD BOX AND IS REPORTED TO HAVE CONTAINED 5 SMALL GLASS BOTTLES. THE BOTTLES WERE WRAPPED IN A THIN LAYE OF BUBBLE WRAP AND THEN PLACED IN A RESEALABLE STORAGE BAG. THERE WERE TWO BAGS TOTAL HOLDING THE FIVE BOTTLES (2 IN ONE AND 3 IN THE OTHER). IT IS REPORTED PACKAGING PEANUTS WERE USED FOR DUNNAGE, BUT IT WAS NOT REPORTED THE AMOUNT OF PEANUTS. IT WAS SEEN ONE OF THE GLASS BOTTLES HAD BROKEN RELEASING .48L OF UN1197. PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A STEEL SALVAGE DRUM AND SHIPPER WAS CONTACTED FOR AN AMENDED SHIPPERS DECLARATION FOR CONTINUED TRAVEL.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Memphis spill agent was called to the dangerous goods building for a leaking shipment. The agent noticed that the bottom of the fiberboard box was wet when they received the shipment and was told the shipment was dropped during the loading process. While investigating the shipment they discovered that one of the four cans inside had a bent bottom chime. This damaged chime caused a release on contents. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended shippers declaration.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Package was brought to the attention of the spill specialist at our Memphis hub location when it was seen a package was leaking. Package consisted of a fiberboard box. Inside the box the contents (2 cans of UN 1263) was placed in a plastic moisture barrier. There was no dunnage to support the contents of the package. The round can inside the package was seen to have positive closure due to plastic ring lock. The second canister in the package was seen to have damage to the exterior of the can. This damage allowed for leakage. It is unknown how the damage occurred. Package was placed in a steel salvage drum and the shipper contacted for an amended shippers declaration for continued travel.

  • Description: 1.X-2022081273SequenceEvent: Package was reported leaking in unload, and removed from trailer with internal leakage. DescribePack: Upon inspection it was discovered the cap on one of the gallon containers was loose, causing the internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA was on site and immediately responded with appropriate materials and procedures to contain release. 2.X-2022081274 QA observed the hazmat package being sent on overhead sorter and immediately notified management. Package was sent up as package handler picking ICs off trailer had his back turned. When the package was removed from the overhead it was placed on the IC belt and tagged to be delivered to load side. Package was later discovered leaking on load side by QA. DescribePack: One of the gallon containers was dented/punctured/cracked, causing the internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA immediately responded to report of leaking hazmat package and used appropriate materials and procedures to contain release.

UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS DETERMINED THAT TWO OF THE FOUR INNER CONTENT LID LOOSEN IN SORTATION PPE AND PROCEDURE WERE PUT IN PLACE TO ASSURE SAFETY AND PREVENT INJURIES DescribePack: PACKAGE LID LOOSEN IN SORTATION LEAKING OUT CONTENTS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE SPILL AREA WAS ISOLATED. item.title: Report X-2022080668
item.description:
Report X-2022080668

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-18T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-19
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was found in unload in door 113 trlr #954849 at 2:02pm. upon inspection the box was in a puddle of its own contents, 2 of the 4 bottles of cleaner had spilled out. package was found on the floor. package leaked all over another box(275660838192) DescribePack: loose caps on two of the bottles of cleaner. box was wet and started to fall apart upon inspection. bottles were also crushed causing the caps to come loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: we used neutralizing agent to control the spill. we moved all of the surrounding boxes to contain the area, as well as warned all of the package handlers in the surrounding area not to touch the affected boxes and to stay away from the affected trailer. we also used a mini dust pan and broom to sweep up the agent.

item.title: Report X-2022080523
item.description:
Report X-2022080523

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-18T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-15
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on floor of trailer at 9:25am, and unload manager contacted QA to retrieve it (which arrived before 9:30). Minor spillage was found around pale but none was on other packages. Spill was neutralized with powder and then absorbed with spill pads. Pale was placed in hazmat tote with hazbag and brought back to QA for processing. DescribePack: Package likely failed either due to a loose, poorly secured lid, improper bracing in trailer, or rough handling at SCHG which caused lid to come loose. Lid was pulled up on one side, causing minor leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Response was immediate and appropriate. No package handlers were allowed near the spill until QA arrived to neutralize it.

Report E-2022070930

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-21
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 21, 2022, one (1) 55-gallon drum containing muriatic acid incurred damage to its lid during transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental and Emergency (E3) to perform the necessary corrective action. E3 personnel overpacked the damaged drum, then utilized neutralizing agent and absorbents to remediate the impacted surface.

item.title: Report E-2022070928
item.description:
Report E-2022070928

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-18T21:08:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-01
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 1, 2022, Landstar contacted ERTS requesting to dispatch a remediation contractor to address a reported unknown amount release of DCPD Laminating Resin at a customers location. Upon contractor arrival and following visual assessment, ERTS was informed by the contractor that no damage to the involved drum was observed, and no active leakage was observed, however, the drum of concern was contained within a plastic secondary containment bag that appeared to have approximately gallon of product also contained w/in the bag. The responding contractor was informed by a representative on site that they thought the leak came from a pinhole sized puncture at the bottom of the drum, but Hepaco personnel did not observe any pinhole. The contents of the drum of concern were successfully transferred into a new drum and affected media was properly cleaned and the contractor generated one 55-gallon drum of waste pending disposal.

  • Description: On July 7, 2022, one (1) 330-gallon tote containing hydrogen peroxide solution was damaged by a forklift and released approximately 0.5 gallon to the concrete loading dock. R+L Carriers (RLC) retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental & Emergency (E3) to perform the necessary corrective action. E3 personnel remediated the impacted surface via absorbents, then performed a gravity transfer of remaining product into one (1) new tote for continued use by RLC.
